>>3838667
Chapter 60: A major event. MIyoshi gives Ayano the worst first kiss in the world and Ayano goes from a cool, confident beauty who'll grab a titty when she feels like it to the most useless lesbian. The previously mentioned chapters of Miyoshi acting cool must have done their job.

On a meta level, volumes four and five are when the manga's finishing its turn from girl on girl antics to a genuine romance. Ai and Chie, who were always the most romantic of the main pairs, are treated more and more as a de facto couple, Eli invites Honoka to her home, we find out Shizuka wants to become Mio's girlfriend and hear that she and Kaoru used to be a couple.

Consequently, Kishi needs to explain why Ayano and Miyoshi and Airi and Michiru, who used to be so reliable at delivering ecchi scenes while clearly not being girlfriends, are not in fact girlfriends. His solution for the former (one is a coward, the other stupid) works better than the latter one. Michiru being in denial about her sexuality feels more like an excuse for still doing early VE style chapters with them rather than any kind of psychological realism.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>3840599
Sounds to me like you just dont like Carol's character, which is fine. But she is really well written in the actual event and so is the emotional core of it. I actually quite adore Carol's absolute positivity no matter the situation. It is really rare trait among this cast that is just full of people with self-doubt. She plays the big bosterous buffoon for the party, but with enough charisma to actually sway people. The entire event was a showcase of how inspiring Carol is as a person, even all the way back as a child. She was her sister's hero just by being kind... and that is what Carol is really all about. She is just always nice and positive, even though without her mask/hero persona she is very shy and not the best at anything. As a character study it by far surpasses the milk toast that is Misarin.

Akarin emerged better from that Misa event than the girl it was actually about. I really, really didnt like Akarin in her character episodes and I found her profoundly annoying, but the Misa event actually made me like her (mildly). The couple of interactions between Carol and Maria in Carol's event had more depth and chemistry than Misarin had with literally anyone. That's just not a good character to base and event around, wouldn't you say? The quality of Carol's event is undeniable, in Misa's I have to scrape for bits to even remember, because nothing stood out. You bring up Inori's event which I consider one of the weakest too and yet I can distinctly remember the character arc Inori takes and the interactions she had with Hisame, Yuina and her team of misfits. Mari's event was the very first and the most prone to being rough (and it was), but it actually managed to do something for 31C and left an impact. If two of the weakest events (Inroi and Mari) can evoke more themes and emotions than Misa's, it is clearly at the bottom for a reason.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>3840623
>Why is the Yuina event so high?
Several reasons, all subjective naturally. Firstly it breaks away from the rigid 3 day structure, which I always find stifling. Only few events actually manage to pace themselves well because of that limitation (Ichigo's and Carol's have immaculate pacing despite it). Although the event ends a bit abruptly, it did stretch over the time span of chapter 1 and 2 and thus had way more room for visible changes in dynamics.
Secondly, the humor just really lands for me. Maeda's comedy can be hit and miss, but I seriously laughed at almost every interaction in this event. Humor is important to humanize these characters. Which brings me to point three: Yuina's characterization. Some of her character episodes/memories already showed it off, but she is a deeply bipolar character and both sides are interesting. You genuinely felt her senpai aura when it was necessary, but also saw what an absolute mess she is on the inside... and that was endearing.
Lastly, as far as milking Aoi fanservice goes, this event did it in the right way, unlike the horrid attempt the Summer event did. We already roughly knew what 30G did during Operation Pleiades, but seeing it first hand and how Aoi's light inspired Yuina gave me goosebumps. That is really important to me, the fact that the thesis of the events isnt that Yuina's revelations are what drive her, but rather her own resolve and devotion to the people around her.

Lastly it actually gave Ruka more depth too. Ruka is in almost all events, but it is the eternal status quo Ruka. Yuina's event is one of the only times we have ever seen Ruka vulnerable and this is owed entirely to her unuque dynamic with Yuina.
>Why is Inori's so low?
It's just decent. Event song is ok, character interactions are alright. Aside from Misa's I dont think any of the events flopped. Inori's being the 2nd lowest doesnt make it bad, just not on the same standard as the rest.

In regards to the music, we didn't compose it ourselves.
Originally it was going to have an original soundtrack, but that fell through.
So most of the music is just royalty free stuff.
Take a look at https://amachamusic.chagasi.com/ and https://musmus.main.jp/
Also try looking up フリーBGM
There's a tonne of Japanese music channels under that and they have pretty loose terms of use.
Just read it carefully and make sure to contact the artist.

And thanks a bunch for your support anon.

>>3838360
The art actually went through a few revisions. I'd post some of the earlier sprites, but I think the artist would kill me if I did that.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>3838727
>I get discouraged due to license issues
Not that anon, but here you go:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1dEbxtBlvwxj2ZwtcoNU05Cg4_pgpuBYAWbO_5twoA2A/edit#gid=0
No matter what the spreadsheet states, always check the license information on a website before you start picking music, some like to add their silly conditions and such, like "you can use this for videos but you have to pay me to use it in games!".
Here's some explanation on common licenses you may have already read:
https://opengameart.org/content/faq
And since it's a common misconception, there's no license that forces you to share the source code of a game just because you included an asset in it, some licenses compel you to share a 'source' version of an asset if you modified it from its original version, but only on request.
Merry listening.

I finished it. Probably a bit too many male sex scenes/ hand job scenes for anyone that wants a Full Yuri NTR game (Girl getting NTR'd by another Girl.) But you can probably just skip most of those and not really miss out on anything. The overall story was pretty good and I'd definitely recommend if you like NTR/Yuri.

Besides that, I only have 2 real complaints. (Spoilers, obviously.) The 1st being that all of the adults are already corrupted by the Mother when the story starts. The FMC, Mitomo, is the only girl we see the progression of falling into being a lesbian. The other childhood friend, Rena, is shown being seduced for 1 scene, but then it cuts away before you see her having sex with the Mother. The next time you see her, she's a pet to the Mother.

The 2nd complaint is that after both Mitomo and Rena admit to being lesbians, they talk about seducing other girls on their own. Rena admits to seducing and having sex her Kouhai, and Mitomo says she's been eyeing a girl and wants to seduce her. Both are never actually shown, just talked about. Probably just a CG budget constraint, I know CG's cost a lot of money, but it would've been nice to see those scenes as well.
